item.title: The Outsiders: Eight Unconventional CEOs and Their Radically Rational Blueprint for Success
item.description:
### Author: William N. Thorndike

  • loc 97 - You really only need to know three things to evaluate a CEO’s greatness: the compound annual return to shareholders during his or her tenure and the return over the same period for peer companies and for the broader market (usually measured by the S&P 500).

  • loc 125 - He was known as “the Sphinx” for his reluctance to speak with either analysts or journalists, and he never once appeared on the cover of Fortune magazine.
